Really good price and fast shipping...having a little trouble figuring it out...it does have so many feature.
The picture I have figured out have come out amazing.

Is ok
Yes I love it
The Sony Cyber-Shot camera is awesome and takes great pictures.
You can even take movies and upload them without a problem to your favorite social media.
When using the zoom feature I was pleasantly surprised at how well the pictures came out.
When i used the zoom on my previous camera the pictures would always come out distorted and blurry.
This camera even has a panorama capabilities, but I have not had the opportunity to use that feature yet, so I cannot honestly tell you how well that feature works.
I am very happy with this camera!
The best feature about this camera is the fact that it comes with a rechargeable battery so no more worrying about having to buy them.
Just plug in the camera the night before using it and you're good.
A full charge lasts for up to 350 shots.
One out of three photos comes out.
I use it for work, real estate, and I have to take three photos of the same shot in order to get one to come out.
Auto, manual, flash, no flash, it doesn't matter.
Because it is for work I bought it in a hurry when my other camera was damaged.
Unfortunately not at Amazon.
A waste of $90.
I've owned it less than a month and cannot get any support even after registering the product.
I will never buy a Sony again.
Very unhappy.

Very disappointed in this camera.
I've had Sony DSC models before that were great, but this one is almost worthless.
It over exposes every photo unless you set it to cut down the light, and even then the set doesn't stay for the next time you turn on the camera.
It has a non-shake feature, but I've still had a ton of blurry photos and the ability to get close to the subject is terrible.
I feel like I wasted my money and this camera wasn't cheap.

Review.author: R. Stephenson
Review.title: Non-moving subjects outdoors on a sunny day? YES. Grandkids running and dancing indoors? NO.

Text.text: Slightly below my phone camera.
Photos at full rez in daylight are not sharp.
Contrast is lower than what you are seeing in the screen.
Actually the screen makes for a better image than the final saved shot.
The main problem is the tiny sensor, a Super HAD CCD sensor which is about 1/10th the size of what an entry DSLR has.
Lens must be plastic for the contrast to go south.
I took shots outdoors hand-held using this SONY and a 3-year old entry level DSLR.
Both are small portions of a full-size print, unretouched, and 350 DPI.
Both look similar when viewed side-by-side on your computer.
But when both are enlarged at the same ratio the older DSLR takes the prize for detail.
Bottom line: this is a $75 or less camera.
It is very small - like about six credit cards taped together.
Lighter than a feather.
If all you are wanting are average shots this will do that.
Car dealers - this may be what you need for your webpage.
However if you are taking photos of fast-moving grandkids indoors this just can't freeze the action.
You will only have photos of blurry kids.
I took it also to the Ringling Bros circus and tried making usuable photos.
Just couldn't do it, plus it slowed the shutter down to one shot about every 7 - 10 seconds.
For cars on a lot or for real estate photos this may be what you can use.
For action or night photos - no way.
Seems okay but pretty run of the mill.
Nothing real special about this camera and the pictures are mediocre.

Review.author: Gary
Review.title: Camera did not include memory card. This is an ...

Text.text: Camera did not include memory card.
This is an extra fee and I do not agree with this type of marketing.

Review.author: Dawn Clark
Review.title: Soooo Slow to take a picture.

Text.text: The pictures of this camera are great, the use of the camera not so great.
It takes eons for the picture to be taken as you press down on the button.
To add to the fun experience, pressing down on the button sometimes does not tell the camera to TAKE the picture, so you have to try again.
All the other functions of the camera are great....just awful wait time.
I am certain there are faster cameras out there.
This camera was crappy and didn’t work right.
I sent it back.
I like this camera because it's beyond expectation.it looks braind new and takes great picture.
I would definitely buy it again.
will not compare to I phone quality

Text.text: only downside to this camera is it is when you are recording video it stops recording every time the file size hits 2GB (about every 10 minutes at 720p) search for sony's 'user guide' for this model for further details

Review.author: B. J. Germick
Review.title: Poor quality pics from what I can see in viewfinder.

Text.text: Just got this within 2 weeks for some good Easter pics since we haven't been able to get together for some time.
I am totally disappointed.
The picture quality is terrible in the viewfinder and the pics won't download to my desktop computer.
It says 'locating pictures and videos'.
and it does nothing more after being plugged in for half an hour.
Good price !
Easy to operate !
Small size and light to carry 👍.
Videos are blurry sometimes and a little dark 👎 Pictures are not too clear 👎.

My old camera, exactly the same Sony, was so much better 👍 I kept it 10 years until I dropped from a second story on a cruise ship 😩😩 And still it was still working, until i couldn’t find any more Memory card for this type of camera!
Sony has established their brand many years ago.
I have the silver model and I do not think color matters as far as performance goes.
This is compact, not large and bulky.
Easy to hold and the picture quality is 'awesome'.
I use it for close-up shots for Jewelry sales.
The best part for me is the re0-chargeable lithium battery.
It lasts quite a long time on the charge and it does not take long to charge it again.
I had been reluctant to own a lithium battery, but was spending so much money on batteries.
If you are on the fence...I really would recommend this one.
It also has 'Panoramic' ability as well as 'movie' ability.
Great little camera.

Review.author: Terry Roberts
Review.title: This is the worst camera I have ever purchased twice

Text.text: This is my third unt.
I thought it was me.
Its not this camera has been used three times.
Now it does not recongized the card and the lens pops in and out regardless of how long its charged.
This is a ripoff.
Can't get any help from SONY>.
This camera only saves two pictures without having a memory card and it did not come with one.
That should have been said in the description.
It arrived in time for my cruise.
I will know once I get photos developed how great it worked.
It was easy to used.
This item I already returned
I bought this from Walmart because they were out of the Cyber-shot DSCW-830 I wanted which is a newer version of my now 6 year old Cyber-shot DSCW-350 that is starting to act up on me.
I figured my Cyber-shot has lasted a good while and takes great pictures this slightly cheaper newer one can't be any worse.
I got it home and tried it out with a picture of the cat and it worked pretty for an $89 camera.
I tried it out again a couple days later to take some pictures of a PlayStation 2 I was repairing and I could not get the thing to focus and take a non blurry picture at all.

I tried sitting it on a tripod and it worked better when I took a picture out my window of the outside, but once I tried to take a picture again of the PS2 on the tripod it was blurry like I tried to run and take the picture.
I was able to fix the blurry issue by using the flash, but then the white balance was so off that a black PS2 looked like it was white.
After messing around with the settings some more I finally gave up went back to Walmart and got my money back.

I just bought a Cybershot DSCW-830 off amazon for the same price as I paid for this one and a warranty from Walmart and until that gets here I am very content and happy with using my old slightly malfunctioning Cyber-shot DSCW-350
I wish I have expended another $50.00 Dlls.
more for something better.
Adequate if you can find it for less than $100, otherwise it's over priced IMHO.
I bought this camera because it would fit easily into my pocket and to use for digital video when a camcorder would be to bulky.
I found it on sale for $89 and thought I was getting a deal.
Well, it wasn't that great of a deal.
It tends to over expose it's shots, is slow to focus, works very poorly in low light and tends to go in and out of focus when videoing moving objects.
The image stabilization works to some degree but not as well as I had hoped for.
The flash is relatively powerful but will over expose anything close while under exposing everything else.
Did not work and I had to send it back.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: My bad for not noticing this was going to ship from ...

Text.text: My bad for not noticing this was going to ship from Malaysia.
Took way too long to receive and then the charger is European, two round prongs instead of a US plug.
Good thing I happen to have one that will fit.
I'm sure the camera is fine but just not satisfied with the shipping time and the charger.
Will pay close attention from now on as to where it ships from.
Ordered July 28th, received August 23rd.
Easy, light, portable, and takes great pictures.

Review.author: CryH
Review.title: This camera is terrible -photos not sharp, very slow

Text.text: This camera is terrible.
The photos are not at all sharp, especially if any zoom is used.
Moving objects are horribly blurred, even still objects are blurry.
When shooting there is a 5 second delay after shooting, where the screen goes black, before you can view the photo taken, needless to say this delay/slowness caused me to miss shots.
Had to return
